resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/107854</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>107854</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205876</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Virtue and Beauty</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Tugend und Schönheit</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Vertu et beauté</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Virtue e beleza</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Virtù e bellezza</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αρετή και ομορφιά</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Virtud y belleza</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">features nearly a dozen portraits of women in Florence created between 1440 and 1540. These paintings, marble sculptures, medals, and drawings reflect a time when subjects in art expanded to include not only rulers and their consorts but also women of the merchant class.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Merkmale fast Portraits Dutzend der Frauen in 
Florenz hergestellt zwischen 1440 und 1540. Diese Anstriche, 
Marmorskulpturen, Medaillen und Zeichnungen reflektieren eine Zeit, 
als Themen in der kunst erweiterten, um nicht nur Tabellierprogramme 
und ihre Gemahle aber auch Frauen zu enthalten der Handelskategorie.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">dispositifs presque verticales une douzaine des 
femmes à Florence créé entre 1440 et 1540. Ces peintures, 
sculptures de marbre, médailles, et schémas reflètent un moment où
des sujets dans l'art augmenté pour inclure non seulement des grilles
de tabulation et leurs époux mais également des femmes de la classe 
marchande.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">características quase retratos uma dúzia das 
mulheres em Florença criado entre 1440 e 1540. Estes pinturas, 
sculptures de mármore, medalhas, e desenhos refletem uma época em 
que os assuntos na arte expandirem para incluir não somente réguas e
seus consorts mas também mulheres da classe mercante.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">caratteristiche quasi ritratti un dozzina delle
donne a Firenze creata fra 1440 e 1540. Queste pitture, sculture
di marmo, medaglie ed illustrazioni riflettono un periodo in cui 
oggetti nell'arte espansa per includere non soltanto i righelli ed i 
loro consorts ma anche donne del codice categoria mercantile.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">χαρακτηρίζει σχεδόν δωδεκάα πορτρέτα των γυναικών στη
Φλωρεντία που δημιουργείται μεταξύ 1440 και 1540. Αυτά
τα έργα ζωγραφικής, μαρμάρινα γλυπτά, μετάλλια, και σχέδια 
απεικονίζουν έναν χρόνο όταν επεκτάθηκαν τα θέματα στην τέχνη 
για να περιλάβουν όχι μόνο τους κυβερνήτες και τους συζύγους 
αλλά και τις γυναίκες τους της εμπορικής κλάσης.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">características casi retratos una docena de 
mujeres en Florencia creada entre 1440 y 1540. Estas pinturas, 
esculturas de mármol, medallas, y gráficos reflejan una época en 
que los temas en el arte ampliado para incluir no solamente a reglas y
sus consorts pero también las mujeres de la clase mercantil.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Künste</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Arti</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τέχνες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205876</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>107854</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/virtue-and-beauty</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
